results.title: Performance appraisal
results.creator_credit: Don Sykes, Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Management by objectives and performance appraisal”.
An industrial education film which uses animation to review all the steps for successful and beneficial performance appraisal, including the gathering of facts, discussion of concrete, measurable objectives, and actual performance, and development of future work goals an plans. With leader’s guide.

results.title: Performance and development review. Part two
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Performance and development review. Part one
results.brief_description: Two scenarios are presented, the first one being a less than ideal setting for a performance appraisal review, and the second one a more favourable setting. In between the two sessions the tape poses questions, then reflects back on the interview in light of the issues raised. Issues covered include effective management styles, dynamics, opportunities, preparation, personal focus, and dealing with problems.

results.title: Perfecting your game
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Table tennis. - Part 4.”.
Part 4 of a series of four films which show that table tennis is a very competitive sport played throughout the world by people of all ages. This film shows specialised strokes and also stresses the importance of the service as a match winning technique. Other matters dealt with are: Balloon Defence, Technique, Hitting the Balloon Defence (Jump Kill), the Drop Shot, Side-spin and services

results.title: Perfect strangers
results.creator_credit: John Chapman, BBC and Stephen Poliakoff
results.brief_description: A drama with family, immigration and belonging the main themes. With a dreamy and slow atmosphere, this family history story unfolds with the use of family photographs as story telling tools. It’s a moving series about relationships and ancestors, history and reunion. Cast includes Michael Gambon and Lindsay Duncan.

results.title: Perfect diet
results.brief_description: Jo Pearson of the Channel 10 Eyewitness News presents a special five-part news feature on diet. Episode 1. Examines the basics of the Australian Nutrition Foundation’s Perfect Diet Pyramid. Episode 2. Highlights the dietary problems of teenagers and children and analyses the Beverly Hills diet. Episode 3. Looks at how fat assessment is carried out and the myth of cellulite. Provides an analysis of Dr. Atkins diet. Episode 4. Shows the characteristics of diets that make people fat and analyses the F-Plan diet. Episode 5. Examines the myths of dieting: e.g. honey is better than sugar, bread and potatoes are fattening and analyses the Scarsdale diet. No other credits available.

results.title: Perfect blue
results.creator_credit: Takeshi Washitani, Manga Entertainment and Satoshi Kon
results.brief_description: Pop-idol Mimarin Kirigoe quits her struggling girl-group CHAM to pursue a career as an actress, despite the protestations of her agents and numerous fans. Her initial resolve is tested when she receives a fax labeling her a “traitor”, but she stubbornly presses on, landing a small role in the sexy television murder mystery, Double Bind. When one of her agents is injured by a letter-bomb meant for her, and the website called “Mima’s Room” starts publishing intrusively intimate details about her daily existence, Mima finds herself caught in a downward spiral of paranoid delusion and regret, struggling to separate fantasy from reality, past from present. As her world fragments into a hallucinatory nightmare, Mima must battle her own inner demons, and protect herself from an obsessed stalker, who is violently murdering her associates. Based on the suspense manga by Yoshikazu Takeuchi.

results.title: Percy Trezise & Dick Roughsey: a journey to Quinkin country
results.creator_credit: Janet Bell, Karl McPhee and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
This program shows how the writer-artist team, Percy Trezise and Dick Roughsey came to produce their brilliant award-winning picture book series based on the Aboriginal legends of Cape York. The program follows Kylie Belling, an Aboriginal actress, as she takes a trip to Quinkin country to meet Percy Trezise in North Queensland where he takes the viewer to see the Aboriginal rock paintings that inspired him. We also learn of his blood brother relationship with Dick Roughsey, the Aboriginal artist.
